text:
The 2023 Legislature is the second session of Republican Gov. Greg Gianforte's first term.

The governor appoints state agency heads and is ultimately responsible for the day-to-day management of government. The governor also prepares a budget proposal that serves as a starting point for the legislative appropriations process, where lawmakers determine how much the governorâ€™s executive branch is allowed to spend.

Bills passed by the Legislature are sent to the governor, who can sign them into law, issue a veto, or let them become law without his signature. Vetos can be overridden by two-thirds majority votes in both the House and Senate.

articles.title: Medicaid and abortion top health agenda for Montana lawmakers
articles.author: Stephanie Farmer

articles.title: Gianforte budget proposal puts state surplus toward tax cuts, infrastructure and Montana State Hospital
articles.author: Mara Silvers
